III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Over the weekend, a youth was on a pass and when they returned
to the facility, they appeared under the influence on an unknown
1

substance. A room and unit search were completed and no
paraphernalia or substances were found. The youth was not drug
screened.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/24/2025 at Vista Maria – Beata
Hall. Youth A stated she was on a home pass starting on
04/18/2025 around 3:00 PM and returned to Vista Maria – Beata
Hall on 04/20/2025 around 9:00 PM. Youth A stated she was
searched upon her return. Youth A stated she emptied her
pockets, took off her shoes, shook her bra and was screened with
a metal detector wand. Youth A stated her personal bag was also
searched. Youth A stated staff (does not recall who) and nurse
(does not know who) asked her if she was under the influence on
04/21/2025. Youth A stated she was not under the influence.
Youth A stated her room and the unit was searched on
04/21/2025 and contraband was not found.
Supervisor was interviewed on 04/24/2025 at Vista Maria – Beata
Hall with Vista Representative. Supervisor stated Staff 1 and Staff
2 reported on 04/21/2025 Youth A looked like she was under the
influence. Supervisor stated he called for Nurse to assess Youth
A. Supervisor stated Youth A’s room and the unit were searched
and contraband was not found. Supervisor stated Youth A did not
have an alcohol or marijuana odor and did not have slurred
speech or gait impairment. Supervisor stated Youth A’s eyes
looked like she could be sleepy or under the influence.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/05/2025 by phone. Staff 1 stated
she did not work with Youth A on 04/21/2025.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 05/06/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
Youth A looked like she was under the influence on 04/21/2025
because her eyelids were low and her demeanor was calmer than
usual. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 also noticed Youth A appeared under
the influence. Staff 2 stated a nurse came to the unit and
assessed Youth A. Staff 2 stated the nurse instructed Staff 2 to
monitor Youth A and call if there was a change with Youth A. Staff
2 stated Youth A’s room and the unit were searched and
contraband was not found.
Nurse was interviewed on 04/24/2025 by phone at Vista Maria
with Vista Representative. Nurse stated she was called to assess
Youth A on 04/21/2025 for the possibility of being under the
influence. Nurse stated Youth A sat with her head back on the
couch in the common area and spoke with her appropriately.
Nurse stated she took Youth A’s blood pressure. Nurse stated
2

Youth A did not have an odor of alcohol or marijuana but
appeared like she could be under the influence. Nurse stated she
requested staff to notify her if Youth A’s condition changed. Nurse
stated she did not recommend drug testing or an urgent care
evaluation for Youth A.
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on
05/06/2025 by phone. FCW stated Youth A has a history of using
substances. FCW stated she met with Youth A at Vista Maria –
Beata Hall on 05/02/2025 and Youth A denied being under the
influence while at Vista Maria.
Documentation
Supervisor wrote an incident report dated 04/21/2025 at 6:00 PM.
It states Staff 1 informed him Youth A appeared to be under the
influence. Nurse was called and she assessed Youth A. Youth A
was not drug tested. Contraband was not found in the search of
Youth A’s room and unit.
Nurse wrote a nursing note dated 04/21/2025 at 6:30 PM. It states
Youth A sat on the couch with her head back with bloodshot eyes.
Youth A denied use of substances or issues. Youth A was able to
answer questions and follow directions. Staff are to monitor Youth
A.
Vista Maria’s Emergency Medical Care WI-0053-004 policy and
procedure states for non-life-threatening situations the shift
supervisor arranges a youth’s offsite emergency care based on
the direction of the nurse or on-call program manager.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for assessing Youth A’s needs
for possibly being under the influence. The facility’s policy states
they are to follow the direction of the nurse, which they did in this
situation.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
